questions: What comes to mind when you hear the word 'destiny'? Do you believe that our lives are pre-determined in some way?
Have you ever consulted a fortune teller, used tarot cards, or explored your 'four pillars of destiny'? What was your experience like, and did it influence your thoughts about your future?
Why do you think more young Koreans are becoming interested in fortune-telling and astrology these days? Do you see it as just a trend, or do you think it reflects a deeper need?
Do you personally believe in destiny, or do you think we create our own paths through choices? Can both ideas exist together?
In your life so far, have you ever felt like something was 'meant to be'? Could you share any personal experience that felt like destiny played a role?
Some people use tarot cards or astrology to feel more in control of uncertainty. Do you think this is an effective way to handle life‚Äôs unpredictability?
How do you think destiny or fate is perceived differently in Korea compared to other cultures? Are there cultural or societal factors that influence these beliefs?
Do you believe that destiny is tied to our relationships with people? Have you ever felt that you were 'destined' to meet someone important in your life?
In modern life, where we focus so much on personal goals and achievement, does believing in destiny feel comforting or limiting to you? Why?
If you could know something about your destiny or future, would you want to? What kind of information would you be curious about, and why?
What does networking mean to you? Do you see it as a social skill, a professional tool, or something else?
How do you usually meet new people in your life? Is it through social events, mutual friends, online platforms, or another way?
Do you think networking is more important for personal life or professional growth? Why do you feel that way?
How has social media influenced the way we network with people? Do you think it's easier or harder to build meaningful connections now?
Have you had any memorable experiences while networking that led to unexpected opportunities? Can you share one that stands out?
What are the biggest challenges you face when trying to network with others? Do you feel comfortable starting conversations with new people?
When it comes to professional networking, do you prefer building a few strong connections or a wide range of contacts? What are the benefits and drawbacks of each approach?
Do you think networking styles differ across cultures? How is networking in Korea different from what you've experienced abroad?
How do you think networking will evolve in the future with advancements in technology and AI? Will it make networking easier or more impersonal?
If you could give advice to someone new to networking, what would it be? What strategies have worked best for you?

3: Storytelling üìñ.Instruction: Ask follow-up questions to learn more about each other‚Äôs stories! üòä
questions: Tell us about a time when you traveled to a place that completely surprised you. What made the experience so unexpected, and how did it change you?
Can you share a story about a moment when you had to make a difficult decision? How did you feel at the time, and do you think you made the right choice in the end?
Describe an experience where you met someone who had a big impact on your life. What made this person special, and how did they influence you?
What‚Äôs a funny or embarrassing situation you‚Äôve been in that you can laugh about now? How did you handle it at the time, and what did you learn from it?
Share a story about a time when you stepped out of your comfort zone. What did you do, and how did it affect your confidence or perspective?
Tell us about a goal or dream you once had but later decided to change. What made you shift your focus, and are you happy with that decision?
Can you remember a time when you received unexpected kindness from a stranger? How did it impact your day or even your view of people?
Talk about a time when you learned something new that completely changed your way of thinking. What was it, and how did it reshape your views?
Share a story of a project or task that seemed impossible at first, but you managed to complete. What motivated you to keep going, and how did you feel once it was done?
Tell us about a time when something went wrong during an event or plan. How did you handle the situation, and did it end up being a good story to tell later?
